div.style: width: 720px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; padding-left: 15px;

span.h1: Participation in the Twinsburg City School District's COVID-19 Meal Program

span.div: During the school closure for COVID-19, the Twinsburg City School District will continue to make breakfast and lunches available to students who are eligible for the Federal Free and Reduced-Price Meal Program or are residents of our school community and are experiencing financial hardship.

Our plan is to distribute five (5) days' worth of meals one time each week usually on Tuesdays to all eligible, participating students at three (3) locations: Reminderville Athletic Club (RAC)/Drug Mart Parking Lot @10:30 a.m., Deer Run @ 11:15 a.m., and Ray Court/Pinewood Gardens @11:30 a.m.). Additionally, five (5)-day meal packages will be available for pick-up at Samuel Bissell Elementary School from 11 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.
The application form closes each Thursday at Noon for the upcoming delivery date.
The next delivery date is set for Tuesday, April 28th.
If you filled out the form for a previous week, you do not need to fill out the form again.

div.a: Please click here to access the form.
